keyMoments.title: Garp's Training Flashback
keyMoments.description: Flashback scenes show young Luffy training under Garp's supervision, declaring his dream to become Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Provides emotional context for the confrontation with Garp.
keyMoments.quote: I want to become the Pirate King!

keyMoments.title: Luffy Strikes Garp
keyMoments.description: Luffy reluctantly punches his grandfather Garp to reach Ace on the execution platform.
keyMoments.significance: One of Luffy's most emotionally difficult decisions, showing his determination to save Ace even at great personal cost.

keyMoments.title: Reaches the Execution Platform
keyMoments.description: Luffy successfully reaches the execution scaffold where Ace is chained.
keyMoments.significance: The culmination of Luffy's journey through Marineford.

keyMoments.title: Gigant Fusen Against Sengoku
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Gigant Fusen to defend against Sengoku's Buddha shockwave attack.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's defensive capabilities against one of the strongest Marines.

keyMoments.title: Frees Ace from Handcuffs
keyMoments.description: Using Mr. 3's wax key, Luffy successfully unlocks Ace's Sea Stone handcuffs.
keyMoments.significance: The climactic success of the rescue mission - Ace is finally freed.

abilities.description: Luffy inflates his body into a massive rubber balloon to defend against powerful attacks.

relationships.description: Luffy is forced to fight his grandfather Garp to reach Ace, creating an emotionally devastating confrontation.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy strikes Garp to pass him and reach Ace, causing emotional pain for both.

keyMoments.title: Training Young Luffy
keyMoments.description: Flashback shows Garp training young Luffy, wanting him to become a Marine while Luffy declares his pirate dream.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights the long-standing conflict between Garp's wishes and Luffy's dreams.

keyMoments.title: Blocks Luffy's Path
keyMoments.description: Garp positions himself as the final obstacle between Luffy and Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Garp's last stand between duty and family.
keyMoments.quote: If you want to pass, you'll have to kill me!

keyMoments.title: Allows Himself to Fall
keyMoments.description: Garp remembers young Luffy and Ace and chooses to take Luffy's punch, falling to allow him to pass.
keyMoments.significance: Garp's ultimate choice to prioritize his grandsons over his Marine duty, while maintaining appearance of having done his job.

relationships.description: Grandfather who raised and trained Luffy, now forced to confront him in battle.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp allows Luffy to defeat him, choosing family over duty in his final moment of decision.

relationships.description: Grandson that Garp helped raise alongside Luffy.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp's decision to fall allows Ace's rescue to proceed.

reveals.information: Garp's internal conflict between duty as a Marine and love for his grandsons reaches its climax

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Freed from Sea Stone Handcuffs
keyMoments.description: Ace's Sea Stone handcuffs are removed by Luffy using Mr. 3's wax key, finally freeing him after his long imprisonment.
keyMoments.significance: The climactic moment of the rescue arc - Ace is freed and can use his powers again.

keyMoments.title: Fire Powers Return
keyMoments.description: Immediately after being freed, Ace uses his Mera Mera no Mi fire powers to break everyone's fall.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Ace regaining his Devil Fruit abilities and return to active combat.

relationships.description: Ace is rescued by Luffy after witnessing the immense sacrifices made for him.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy successfully frees Ace from his handcuffs, completing the rescue mission.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Himself as Executioner
keyMoments.description: Mr. 3 reveals he had been disguised as one of Ace's executioners and intends to help with the rescue.
keyMoments.significance: Unexpected twist showing Mr. 3's infiltration and his decision to help Luffy for Bon Clay's sake.

keyMoments.title: Creates Wax Key
keyMoments.description: Galdino uses his Doru Doru no Mi powers to create a replacement key from wax after Kizaru destroyed Hancock's key.
keyMoments.significance: Mr. 3's quick thinking saves the rescue mission. His actions are motivated by avenging Bon Clay.

relationships.description: Mr. 3's motivation for helping Luffy stems from his desire to avenge Bon Clay, who helped Luffy in Impel Down.

evolutionMoments.description: Mr. 3 reveals he's helping Luffy to honor Bon Clay's friendship and sacrifice.

reveals.information: Mr. 3 is helping Luffy to avenge Bon Clay (Mr. 2)

keyMoments.title: Buddha Form Transformation
keyMoments.description: Sengoku transforms into a giant golden Buddha, revealing his Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Daibutsu Devil Fruit powers for the first time.
keyMoments.significance: First reveal of Sengoku's Mythical Zoan Devil Fruit ability, demonstrating why he is Fleet Admiral.

abilities.description: Sengoku transforms into a giant golden Buddha, gaining immense size and strength.
A powerful shockwave attack unleashed from Sengoku's Buddha form.

reveals.information: Sengoku possesses the Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Daibutsu, a Mythical Zoan Devil Fruit

keyMoments.title: Destroys Hancock's Key
keyMoments.description: Kizaru uses his light-speed abilities to destroy the key to Ace's handcuffs with a laser beam.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a major setback in the rescue mission, seemingly destroying hope of freeing Ace.

keyMoments.title: Her Key is Revealed
keyMoments.description: Luffy reveals the key to Ace's handcuffs that Hancock had secretly given him.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hancock's crucial contribution to the rescue mission through her secret assistance.
